reviews.review_msg: He talks a lot about other things irrelevant to the course. You're better off sticking to the textbook (that he wrote so all the info is relevant!). He is definitely a more caring professor, always offering to consult students about grad school and getting into research. Two midterms, the final and 5% of the grade was participation.

Dr Cox is extremely knowledgable and passionate about his work. His lectures can be really interesting however, it is crucial to read the textbook outside of class. Half his lecture is stories and tangents making it difficult to follow what is necessary for the exams. Multiple choice is really hard.

Fav prof at sfu, lectures are 3 hrs but the least boring 3 hr lecture you'll ever take. He does ramble but it makes you really want to pay attention. For exams, just memorize textbook terms and go over chapter summaries. Would take this course again if I could I really enjoyed the content

Memorizing the textbook matters most: weight is 95:5 for exams:participation. Content is intuitive but beware: defend your written section+go over your MC bc I would've missed FULL marks had I not (TA couldn't substantiate my lower mark); Dr. Cox straight up lost my midterm, the one that was suspiciously low..got an A still so didn't fuss about it.

Dr. Cox is one of the best profs at SFU. He is so kind, caring, and approachable. He made classes engaging by making us laugh, and sharing various applications of course concepts through new articles he had found. The MTs are pretty straightforward if you go to class and read the textbook. Study hard for the final though because it's trickier!

Honestly I regret taking this class. The lectures are incredibly boring as he just rambles and pulls out random articles that he doesn't link on Canvas, or even seem to test on. Grade is made up entirely of exams (25% for each midterm and 50% final) and seem to be based entirely on the textbook. Would not recommend.

David is ok. He's nice, but he rambles and that loses engagement. The class is 95% exam and 5% (easy) in-class assignments, so there aren't many other places to demonstrate learning. The SA on exams is quite hard and many people struggle with it. You need to provide specific answers/facts. The curve wasn't as great as he made it out to be. :/

Great prof and TAs. Exams are fair and test heavily on the textbook. You need to mention every detail under certain topics but the multiple choices are just free marks. The Mp3 files could be kinda weird but I liked his lectures. Exams took half a month to be graded but yea he's still a good prof. Take a course with him and benefited.

He is good at teaching and gives interesting lectures even though those mp3 files are confusing. It could be better to watch the slides with it but improvements still could be made. Grading was fair and as long as you read the textbook hard you will be fine.

The material was alright, but nothing super interesting like I was told based on other reviews from others. Most of the lectures are based off the textbook, and he adds some extra thoughts/stories to whichever section youre discussing. Attendance needed to get the assignment questions, mc super easy, short answer needs lots of details for marks.

David is a very interesting speaker and lectures are very informative and also very eye opening. If you read the textbook you will be good for exams. However, for the long answers you have to list basically everything on the topic to get full marks so be prepared. If you are looking for a very interesting class though highly recommend!

David is engaging and has great stories but tends to be repetitive. Slides are identical to what's in the text so you don't really need to go to class. Be prepared to read the textbook from cover to cover and memorize the whole thing to do well. Super test heavy, final was cumulative (covering 11 chapters) and worth 45% of final grade.

Dr. Cox is an amazing prof. His midterms are fair (mostly textbook based), he's available outside of class time, and he makes lectures interesting. No papers, just 2 midterms and a cumulative final. Humorous man, would definitely take his class again!

Don't need to show up to class but David's lectures are very interesting. He brings in current issues and personal experiences about health. For exams, just read the textbook, understand main points, and use ppt slides as study guides.

David is a wonderful lecturer - I've always found his lectures  to be entertaining. However, to pass this class all you need to do is read the book which he helped write himself. Overall grade is based on three exams that are made up of 50 MC, 8 definitions, and 2 long answer Qs. He gives great advice and inspirational stories!

Very awesome and passionate professor. Exams are easy if you study well.  But the TM's mark the written portion very hard. Would highly recommend this class just because of the prof. Anyone would enjoy David Cox's lectures and his stories. He is an amazing professor.

I'm not too sure if it's me who just don't like the topic, but personally, I don't really like this class. I found his lectures to be very boring and bland. His exams are not too hard, he won't ask on too much specific details. He's a fair prof, but not for everyone, make sure u really are into health system, otherwise u'll hate this class.

Attendance optional. Study the book instead and memorize possible long question answers such as health models, theories etc. Lecture isn't recorded. I got an A and I only attended twice--for midterms and finals.

This class was 09:30 in the morning so I never came to class. No lecture recordings too but I heard his lectures are interesting. I would've gone if it wasn't so early. Lots of memorization for the midterms short&long answers ex. theories. Attendance isn't mandatory just study the book and memorize possible long question answers . I got an A :)

David's one of the best profs I've ever had. He's super funny and able to captivate an audience. I would say attendance is not mandatory at all but he does talk about some awesome stuff during lectures. Lastly, the exams are not all that difficult for a 3rd year class but do require some reading. Make sure you read lots for the 12 chapter final.

Cox is really into the topics he teaches which makes the course really interesting. Even though I would say attendance isn't mandatory, I highly recommend that you still go because he goes off topic and talks about really cool stuff! Exams are fair, and marking si pretty fair too!

Had him for health psyc. I agree- makes 3 hour lecture very interesting and funny guy! Tests are super easy and right from the text- know the definitions. WARNING though: the tutor marker marks super hard! Don't make an easy test if you are going to mark super hard- DUMB! Just lettin' ya know.
he is a very cool teacher and very approachable. In order to do well, ya gotta read his book and memorize all the bold definitions.
Very Interesting Class~

If you are interested in the subject, then he's a fantastic teacher. He tells you stories and makes a 3 hour class very entertaining. However, if you only want a grade, skip all lectures and memorize the textbook like me and get an A! :) TA was aweful; took her 3 weeks to mark the midterm and was unclear about the requirements for the written part.
Great prof. liked going to class. midterm was easy but paper was kinda hard. Tons of guest speakers, he wrote the textbook, so thats all u need to study. Nice person, u cant help but like this guy.

The best professor at SFU hands down. You are stupid if you don't JUMP to the chance to take a course with him, because it will probably be the only Psyc course at SFU where the waitlists have waitlists and 5000 people are wanting to take it. Only downfall to his classes: not enough seats 150. Exams are okay, papers were hard:research study.

FANTASTIC prof! Love him! He motivates students, and that's the best quality any prof can have! He totally got me into seriously considering the health field professions. He goes off topic alot of times, often telling us life stories which makes lec more interesting. Exams not hard; all based on the text & no tricky Qs. Overall an excellent class!
he's really into what he does....he talks a LOT but most of the time its interesting stuff....paper is really easy
No Comments
someone needs to teach him that the world won't end if he posts his lecture slides on webct
very good teacher, fair exams (based mainly on the textbook)
super nice guy. exams and paper topic on the easy side.

Chatterbox...BUT SOOO KNOWLEDGABLE!!!There is absoloutley no point in attending lecture (exam info wise as he ONLY tests on his textbook which he LOVES because HE WROTE!) but it is worth it to sit in his class for 3 hours and listen to him go off about random things...it brings the class to life! B+
No Comments
Kept things interesting - never saw anyone asleep!
Great professor. So much information and all interesting. Know the text and you'll do really well. Exams are fair but tight for time. One of the best professors I've had so far.
he is great...made the class really interesting!

I don't know why Keith has such low reviews? He's a great instructor and you can tell cares about the wellbeing of students. He's a grad (I think Phd now) student so he gets the stress of school & tries to accommodate to such. Psyc 365 is a lot of material, making it hard for any prof to cover everything in class - hence why he says to read the TB
Keith is pretty much unhelpful. Asked for questions regarding lectures, he would say it's in the slides or textbook. But the course was interesting. I learnt a lot. Read the textbook

The professor was kind and the course was easy yet engaging. Reading the textbook was crucial for exams. Although there were two midterms, the final was cumulative and had 100+ multiple-choice and a few essay questions. Be ready to read if you take this course.

Bri is a great prof considering she hasn't been teaching long. Attendance is 5% which are easy in-class assignments. A lot of material is covered in this course so if you want to get an A, do the readings and memorize the slides. If you've studied everything then MTs are easy but if you haven't then questions will seem very specific.
Gary really is a wonderful prof. Extremely genuine and funny. However his exams were tough, be prepared for a lot of memorization especially on tiny details from the textbook.
